channel.title: Dupe
channel.description:
So, theres a dupe where if you x log while in a trade screen you both get the item, how would i fix it.
I was thinking like if you xlog while in trade screen, your account stays logged in until trade screen is done, but idk how to do that help please...

item.title: Dupe
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

just make sure that when the player is disconnected (disconnected, NOT manually logged out) that the items are returned.

Read full topic

item.title: Dupe
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Gone a little off topic here… And does the removing off the x prevent alt f4ing, or stopping the process?

@OP - ignore the removing x, it’s pointless. People will still be able to close the window. Focus on the problems server sided, that way the end user can do whatever they want when closing, and it won’t have any effect on gameplay. Look at the state the player is in before disconnecting (trading), if they’re in a trade when logging out, you decline the trade for both players, resulting in no item loss.

Read full topic

item.title: Dupe
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:537554”][quote author=DAn0194 link=topic=656378.msg4392469#msg4392469 date=1388008847]

Where when they click x it doesn’t do anything.
[/quote]

Oh, hey, dan. Since you don’t care to believe me, here:

And the source code:

[code=java]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class Testing{

public void buildGUI(){

	JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);  
	JFrame f = new JFrame();  
	f.setResizable(false);  
	removeMinMaxClose(f);  
	JPanel p = new JPanel(new GridBagLayout());  
	f.getContentPane().add(p);  
	f.setSize(400,300);  
	f.setLocationRelativeTo(null);  
	f.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);  
	f.setVisible(true);

}

public void removeMinMaxClose(Component comp){

if(comp instanceof AbstractButton){  
	comp.getParent().remove(comp);  
}

if (comp instanceof Container){  
	Component[] comps = ((Container)comp).getComponents();  
	for(int x = 0, y = comps.length; x < y; x++){  
		removeMinMaxClose(comps[x]);  
	}  
}

}

public static void main(String[] args){  
	SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable(){
		public void run(){  
			new Testing().buildGUI();  
		}  
	});  
}

}[/code][/quote]
^ Dem legend

Read full topic

item.title: Dupe
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:12, topic:537554”]setDefaultCloseOperation(WindowConstants.DO_NOTHING_ON_CLOSE)

Where when they click x it doesn’t do anything.[/quote]

Oh, hey, dan. Since you don’t care to believe me, here:

And the source code:

[code=java]import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class Testing{

public void buildGUI(){

	JFrame.setDefaultLookAndFeelDecorated(true);  
	JFrame f = new JFrame();  
	f.setResizable(false);  
	removeMinMaxClose(f);  
	JPanel p = new JPanel(new GridBagLayout());  
	f.getContentPane().add(p);  
	f.setSize(400,300);  
	f.setLocationRelativeTo(null);  
	f.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);  
	f.setVisible(true);

}

public void removeMinMaxClose(Component comp){

if(comp instanceof AbstractButton){  
	comp.getParent().remove(comp);  
}

if (comp instanceof Container){  
	Component[] comps = ((Container)comp).getComponents();  
	for(int x = 0, y = comps.length; x < y; x++){  
		removeMinMaxClose(comps[x]);  
	}  
}

}

public static void main(String[] args){  
	SwingUtilities.invokeLater(new Runnable(){
		public void run(){  
			new Testing().buildGUI();  
		}  
	});  
}

}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Dupe
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:12, topic:537554”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=656378.msg4392463#msg4392463 date=1388006946]

Or you could just prevent x logging all in itself.

Preventing X logging is impossible, sooner or later the person would have to log out can’t stay on 24\7 (if you make a person stay online 24\7 after x logging he will never be able to login until server is restarted.

And you can’t prevent anyone from pressing X on the game or doing end task on the java.exe of the game.

Lmao of course you can prevent anyone from pressing x on the game or ending tasks in Task manager.

And i could easily tell you how to.

No, you really can’t stop them (unless you were to remove the x…).

Plus, their pc’s could crash at any moment.
OR they could force shut down
or just unplug it.

You can’t remove the x lol.

Technically, you can:

i use swing. no gui frameworks/ide plugins. i just dont like the default jframe titlebar so i removed it by setting the shape of the window (removes titles) and then i just added my own custom title bar (jmenubar) and created my own ‘close’ button.

Notice how he made his own close button…
Here’s the gui:
[img]http://i.imgur.com/L6jLVco.jpg[img]

Yah he changed how it looks but you can’t remove the actual x.

Facepalm
[/quote]
I love how you facepalm but you have no idea what your saying. You can’t remove the x button from JFrames. Anyways a good option you could use is.

Where when they click x it doesn’t do anything.[/quote]
You still don’t get it?
This is removing the x. The function which closes the window/ends the task will be removed, but the x will still show up.

Btw. Why are my posts always getting deleted automatically?

Read full topic
